author: _bluelite
content: HI, There is a question. Only point_evaluation_precompile is deployed now, but our op project needs to upload original data during the challenge (not multi-round interactive). How can this re-uploaded original data be verified to be equal to the blob?

author: __flcl
content: Are you asking how to send blobs? https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-4844#blob-transaction is used for that.

author: _bluelite
content:
NO,  Blobs have already been sent in the previous transaction and versioned_ Hash saved the contract.
Now I am sending another transaction again, which contains the same data as the blob in the previous transaction. I need to verify in the contract that the data in the second transaction is equivalent to the blob in the first transaction.

author: __flcl
content: You may just compare hashes, should be enough. (Seems like you need to save hash for blob from previous tx in the contract storage)

author: _bluelite
content: Calculate the versioned hash in the contract and compare it with the previous one? It seems impossible

author: __flcl
content: Oh I see, you want to send blob via calldata in the second call, right?

author: _bluelite
content: Yes, and verify that it is equivalent to the previous blob.

author: _bluelite
content: Obstacle: How to use solidity verify verify (z, y) in polynomial. If you can verify that (z, y) exists in both blob and polynomial, then you can prove that data and blob are equivalent. Try passing z to polynomial in the contract to calculate y and compare it with y uploaded off-chain?

author: jochembrouwer
content:
Hi <@892053833121923094> <@755913785620824175> , we have this test: https://hivecancun.ethdevops.io/viewer.html?suiteid=1698232457-b8b2fa526e05d96e3960d3ecdeaf8560.json&suitename=engine-cancun&testid=197&showtestlog=1 which also fails locally. Suspicious lines are (in logs):

```
>> (5ffe76e2) {"jsonrpc":"2.0","id":24,"method":"engine_forkchoiceUpdatedV3",...
<< (5ffe76e2) {"jsonrpc":"2.0","id":24,"error":{"code":-32602,"message":"invalid argument 1 for key 'parentBeaconBlockRoot': argument must be a hex string"}}
>> (5ffe76e2) {"jsonrpc":"2.0","id":15,"method":"eth_getBlockByNumber","params":["latest",false]}
<< (5ffe76e2) {"jsonrpc":"2.0","id":15,"result":{"number":"0x5", ...
DEBUG (Invalid PayloadAttributes: Missing BeaconRoot): Forkchoice is applied even on invalid payload attributes
```

We reject the FCU, and if you check the (Syncing) variant we essentially do the same - but we pass that one. I can see that other clients do not have this behavior but I am also not sure what we are doing wrong here? ðŸ¤”

author: m.kalinin
content: the test expects you to apply the forkchoice state in spite of invalid payloadAtrributes, there is a discussion thread on this problem: https://github.com/ethereum/execution-apis/pull/479

author: m.kalinin
content: you're more than welcome to comment on that thread

author: jochembrouwer
content: I will once I completely figure out what's going on and if I can add something to the discussion, thanks ðŸ™‚ And also thanks for the pointer to this one!
